intro: Palicourea lancigera, commonly known as the slender leaf palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Palicourea lancigera thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks.
